description: Performs exhaustive grid search over specified hyperparameter combinations to find optimal model settings. Each combination in the parameter grid is evaluated using cross-validation or a hold-out validation set, and the best configuration based on the specified metric is returned.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: An untrained machine learning model object that will be trained and evaluated for each hyperparameter combination.

parameters.name: training_data
parameters.description: Training samples. Can be provided as a URL to a data file, a local file path, or an inline data object depending on the backend implementation.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Hyperparameter grid defining the search space. Each key is a hyperparameter name, and each value is an array of candidate values to try. All combinations will be evaluated.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Name of the target/label column in the training data.

parameters.name: scoring
parameters.description: Metric used to evaluate and compare model performance. Common metrics include 'accuracy', 'kappa', 'f1', 'precision', 'recall', 'auc'.

parameters.name: cv
parameters.description: Number of cross-validation folds. If 0 or 1, uses a single train/validation split instead of cross-validation.

parameters.name: validation_split
parameters.description: Fraction of training data used for validation when cv <= 1. Ignored when using cross-validation.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: Random seed for reproducibility of data splits and model training.

returns.description: Tuning results including the best hyperparameters and performance metrics for all evaluated combinations.

best_params.description: The hyperparameter combination that achieved the best score.

results.description: All evaluated parameter combinations with their scores.
